instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the related study on measuring soil organic matter and total nitrogen conten?
Output: In the related study on measuring soil organic matter and total nitrogen content, the spectrum used was the visible spectrum and near-infrared spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the related study on measuring soil organic matter and total nitrogen content?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used in the related study on measuring soil organic matter and total nitrogen content using visible/near-infrared spectroscopy were the successive projections algorithm (SPA) and the linear partial least squares regression (PLSR) model. Additionally, a nonlinear least squares support vector machine (LS-SVM) model was also used.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the prediction accuracy of the models used in the related study on measuring soil organic matter and total nitrogen content?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the prediction accuracy of the models used in the related study on measuring soil organic matter and total nitrogen content using visible/near-infrared spectroscopy is R-pre(2) (R-squared prediction), RMSEP (Root Mean Square Error of Prediction), and RPD (Ratio of Performance to Deviation).The best result in the related study was obtained using the nonlinear LS-SVM model, which had an R-pre(2) of 0.88, an RMSEP of 0.10, and an RPD of 2.95 for soil organic matter content. For total nitrogen content, the nonlinear LS-SVM model had an R-pre(2) of 0.90, an RMSEP of 0.01, and an RPD of 3.19.

instruction: What optimization method was used to optimize the nonlinear least squares support vector machine (LS-SVM) model in the related study on measuring soil organic matter and total nitrogen content using visible/near-infrared spectroscopy?
Output: The optimization method used to optimize the nonlinear LS-SVM model in the related study on measuring soil organic matter and total nitrogen content using visible/near-infrared spectroscopy was a two-step grid search method.

instruction: Can visible/near-infrared spectroscopy be considered a superior method compared to traditional methods for accurately measuring soil organic matter and total nitrogen content in different types of soil, based on the findings of the related study?
Output: Yes.Based on the findings of this study, visible/near-infrared spectroscopy can be considered a superior method compared to traditional methods for accurately measuring soil organic matter and total nitrogen content in different types of soil. The study showed that the nonlinear model LS-SVM, which utilized visible/near-infrared spectroscopy, had better prediction accuracy compared to the linear partial least squares regression (PLSR) model. This may be attributed to the nonlinear relationship between soil spectral information and soil physical and chemical properties. Additionally, the characteristic wavelengths screened by the continuous projection algorithm improved the model accuracy and optimized the model operation efficiency. The study concluded that visible/near-infrared spectroscopy has great potential in the field of soil detection and can achieve better prediction results for soil organic matter and total nitrogen content.
